documentation:
The pysical model defines the core entities that make up the
physical dimension of MASD conceptual space.

elements.name: entities
elements.documentation: Defines the MASD physical space.

elements.name: entities::location
elements.documentation:
Location of an entity or set of entities in the hierarchical physical space.

These must be populated in order, e.g. in order to have a backend we must have a
meta-model; in order to have a facet we must have a backend and in order to have a
formatter we must have a facet. We may not have any.

attributes.name: meta_model
attributes.documentation:
Top-most container for the physical space.

The meta-model is always expected to be  @e masd.

attributes.name: backend
attributes.documentation: Name of the backend that owns this field, if any.

attributes.name: facet
attributes.documentation: Name of the facet that owns this field, if any.

attributes.name: archetype
attributes.documentation: Name of the archetype that owns this field, if any.

elements.name: helpers
elements.documentation: Helpers for the physical model.

attributes.name: meta_names
attributes.documentation: All meta-names that belong to this group.

attributes.name: canonical_locations
attributes.documentation:
Maps a concrete archetype location to its canonical form, if the canonical
form is supported. Otherwise no such mapping will exist.

elements.name: entities::meta_name_indices
elements.documentation: Containing physical meta-names, indexed as required by use cases.

attributes.name: all
attributes.documentation: All meta-names.

attributes.name: facet_names_by_backend_name
attributes.documentation: Qualified names of facets by qualified names of backends.

attributes.name: formatter_names_by_backend_name
attributes.documentation: Qualified archetype names by qualified backend names.

attributes.name: by_logical_meta_name
attributes.documentation: Physical meta-names by logical meta-names.

attributes.name: by_backend_by_facet
attributes.documentation: Archetype names by qualified backend and facet names

elements.name: helpers::building_error
elements.documentation: An error occurred while the field factory was building.

elements.name: entities::meta_model
elements.documentation:
Describes the geomtry of physical space.

Provides details of the backends available in the current instance of Dogen.

attributes.name: enablement_flags
attributes.documentation: Global enablement flags

attributes.name: template_instantiation_domains
attributes.documentation:
Provides all of the domains to be used for template instantiation.

Example of a domain is "masd.facet" which contains the list of all available facets.
Templates (facet and profile) are then instantiated over this range, depending on
user choices.

attributes.name: backends
attributes.documentation: All backends available in this meta-model.

attributes.name: indexed_names
attributes.documentation: Repository with all the meta-names in this meta-model, indexed appropriately.

elements.name: entities::backend
elements.documentation: Code generation backend, targeting a given technical space.

attributes.name: requires_relative_path
attributes.documentation: If true, this part needs a path relative to its root.

elements.name: entities::path_configuration
elements.documentation: Describes how paths are handled within a part.

attributes.name: external_modules
attributes.documentation: What kind of contribution do the external modules make to the final path.

attributes.name: model_modules
attributes.documentation: What kind of contribution do the model modules make to the final path.

attributes.name: facet
attributes.documentation: What kind of contribution does the facet make to the final path.

attributes.name: internal_modules
attributes.documentation: What kind of contribution do the internal modules make to the final path.

elements.name: entities::path_contribution_type
elements.documentation: Different kinds of contributions that can be made to the final path computation.

attributes.name: none
attributes.documentation: The item does not contribute at all to the path.

attributes.name: as_directories
attributes.documentation: The item contributes folders to the path.

attributes.name: as_path_components
attributes.documentation: The item contributes a single folder to the path, as a delimited string.

attributes.name: default_archetype_for_logical_meta_model_id
attributes.documentation:
Maps the logical model element ID to the default archetype for this facet.

Used to obtain the default archetype for referencing.

elements.name: entities::archetype
elements.documentation: Represents a meta-artefact.

attributes.name: archetype_kind_id
attributes.documentation: ID for the archetype kind that this archetype is an instance of.

attributes.name: logical_meta_element_id
attributes.documentation: ID of the meta-element in the logical model this archetype binds to.

attributes.name: part
attributes.documentation: Part in which we are located.

attributes.name: relations
attributes.documentation: Properties of this archetype with regards to relations.

elements.name: entities::logical_name
elements.documentation: Physical representation of a logical name.

elements.name: entities::model
elements.documentation: Collection of entities representing objects in physical space.

attributes.name: technical_space
attributes.documentation: Primary technical space that this model belongs to.

attributes.name: artefact_sets_by_logical_id
attributes.documentation: All atefact sets in this model, by logical ID.

attributes.name: orphan_artefacts
attributes.documentation: Artefacts that exist in the physical dimension only.

attributes.name: description
attributes.documentation: Human readable description of the entity.

elements.name: entities::MetaNameable
elements.documentation: Ability to have a meta-name.

attributes.name: meta_name
attributes.documentation: Meta-name for this meta-element.

elements.name: entities::Labelable
elements.documentation: The ability to attach labels to an element.

attributes.name: labels
attributes.documentation: All labels associated with this element.

attributes.name: default_directory_name
attributes.documentation: Default directory name.

attributes.name: override_directory_name
attributes.documentation: Override directory name, if any.

attributes.name: default_postfix
attributes.documentation: Default postfix for the element.

attributes.name: override_postfix
attributes.documentation: Overridden postfix, if any.

elements.name: features
elements.documentation: Features for the MASD physical model.

elements.name: features::facet_features
elements.documentation: Physical features common to all facets.

attributes.name: directory
attributes.documentation: Directory in which to place this facet.

attributes.name: postfix
attributes.documentation: Postfix to use for all files that belong to this facet.

attributes.name: overwrite
attributes.documentation: If true, the generated files will overwrite existing files.

elements.name: features::archetype_features
elements.documentation: Features common to all archetypes.

attributes.name: postfix
attributes.documentation: Postfix to use for all files that belong to this facet.

attributes.name: overwrite
attributes.documentation: If true, the generated files will overwrite existing files.

elements.name: entities::artefact
elements.documentation: Represents an entity in physical space.

attributes.name: archetype_id
attributes.documentation: ID of the archetype that this artefact is an instance of.

attributes.name: content
attributes.documentation: Content of the file.

attributes.name: relative_paths
attributes.documentation: Paths relative to the path ID that keys the container.

attributes.name: dependencies
attributes.documentation: Files in the project directory that this file depends on, but which are not generated.

attributes.name: relations
attributes.documentation:
Artefacts that this artefact depends on.

The format used is dependent on the technical space the artefact belongs to.

attributes.name: unified_diff
attributes.documentation: Unified diff between the in-memory artefact and the file in the filesystem.

attributes.name: enablement_flags
attributes.documentation: Local enablement flags.

elements.name: entities::Configurable
elements.documentation: Ability to have meta-data associated.

attributes.name: configuration
attributes.documentation: Configuration for this element.

elements.name: entities::DeterminableOrigin
elements.documentation: Properties related to the origin of the modeling element.

attributes.name: origin_sha1_hash
attributes.documentation: SHA1 hash of the original model that contained the element.

attributes.name: logical_name
attributes.documentation: Logical model details of the element that originated this physical element.

attributes.name: physical_meta_name
attributes.documentation: Physical model details of the meta-element that originated this element.

elements.name: entities::Nameable
elements.documentation: Ability to have a name.

attributes.name: name
attributes.documentation: Name of the physical element.

elements.name: entities::outputting_properties
elements.documentation: Properties related to outputting.

elements.name: entities::operation
elements.documentation: Operation to apply to an artefact.

elements.name: entities::operation_type
elements.documentation: Operation to perform to a given artefact.

attributes.name: create_only
attributes.documentation: Creates a file from an artefact only if it does not yet exist.

attributes.name: write
attributes.documentation: Unconditionally writes an artefact into file.

attributes.name: ignore
attributes.documentation: Ingores an artefact.

attributes.name: remove
attributes.documentation: Deletes a file.

elements.name: entities::operation_reason
elements.documentation: Reasons for performing an operation.

attributes.name: newly_generated
attributes.documentation: Artefact will produce a new generated file.

attributes.name: changed_generated
attributes.documentation: Artefact will produce a changed generated file.

attributes.name: unchanged_generated
attributes.documentation: Generated artefact contents match file contents.

attributes.name: already_exists
attributes.documentation: The file already exists and we we're asked to create only.

attributes.name: ignore_generated
attributes.documentation: User requested artefact to be ignored.

attributes.name: force_write
attributes.documentation: User requested to always write generated artefacts.

attributes.name: unexpected
attributes.documentation: Artefact represents an unexpected file in project.

attributes.name: ignore_unexpected
attributes.documentation: File is unexpected but the user asked us not to delete it.

attributes.name: ignore_regex
attributes.documentation: File is unexpected but the user asked us to ignore it via regexes.

elements.name: features::filesystem
elements.documentation: Features related to filesystem operations.

attributes.name: force_write
attributes.documentation:
If true, artefacts are always written to the filesystem.

If false, the system will check to see if writing is needed by performing a binary
diff. If no changes are detected, no writting is performed.

attributes.name: delete_extra_files
attributes.documentation:
If true, any files the code generator is not aware of are deleted.

If you'd like to skip the deletion of certain files, set  "ignore_files_matching_regex" accordingly.

attributes.name: ignore_files_matching_regex
attributes.documentation:
Regular expressions to filter files prior to deletion.

Only applicable if "delete_extra_files" is enabled.

attributes.name: delete_empty_directories
attributes.documentation:
If true, all directories without any files will be deleted.

This setting is recursive: if a directory is composed of one or more directories that
are themselves empty, the entire directory tree is deleted.

attributes.name: enable_backend_directories
attributes.documentation:
If true, a directory is created for each technical space targeted.

Note that this setting is only relevant if you are targetting a single output technical
space. If you are targetting more than one, it will automatically be set to true.

elements.name: transforms
elements.documentation:
Contains all of the transforms needed to produce
models and meta-models for the physical model.

elements.name: features::enablement
elements.documentation: Enablement related properties.

attributes.name: enabled
attributes.documentation: If true, decorations are enabled on this modeling element.

elements.name: features::formatting
elements.documentation: Features related to formatting.

attributes.name: formatting_style
attributes.documentation: Style of formatting to use for this archetype.

attributes.name: formatting_input
attributes.documentation: If the formatting style requires a template, the name of the template to use.

elements.name: entities::meta_name
elements.documentation:
Name of an element in physical space.

A name represents a point or a region in physical space. It can only be used by one
physical element. Names can be uniquely identified by their qualified ID.

Name has the following properties: a) two different points or regionsin physical
space cannot have the same name and b) the same point or region in physical space
can only have one and only one name.

attributes.name: simple
attributes.documentation:
Simple (non-qualified) name of the physical element at this address.

The simple name must be unique for a given location.

attributes.name: qualified
attributes.documentation: Qualified name for a physical element.

attributes.name: location
attributes.documentation: Location for a name in physical space.

elements.name: helpers::validation_error
elements.documentation: An error occurred during validation.

attributes.name: simple
attributes.documentation: File or directory simple name.

attributes.name: qualified
attributes.documentation:
Absolute path to the file or directory.

The qualified name indicates the location in the filesystem where it will be
written or where it was sourced from.

elements.name: entities::Associatable
elements.documentation: The meta-element is associated with other meta-elements

attributes.name: depends
attributes.documentation: List of meta-elements this meta-element depends upon, if any.

attributes.name: generates
attributes.documentation: List of meta-elements this meta-element is used to generate, if any.

attributes.name: generated_by
attributes.documentation: Meta-element used to generate this meta-element, if any.

elements.name: entities::model_set
elements.documentation: Represents a set of related physical models.

attributes.name: models
attributes.documentation: All models that are a member of this set.

elements.name: transforms::minimal_context
elements.documentation: Smallest possible context required for bootstrapping purposes.

elements.name: entities::relation_status
elements.documentation: Status of a given archetype with regards to being related to other archetypes.

attributes.name: not_relatable
attributes.documentation: Archertype cannot be legally related to other archetypes.

attributes.name: relatable
attributes.documentation: Archetype can be related to archetypes.

attributes.name: facet_default
attributes.documentation: FIXME: hack for now

elements.name: entities::label
elements.documentation: A label is a key-value pair that can be used by the processing engine in a flexible way.

attributes.name: key
attributes.documentation: Key of the label.

attributes.name: value
attributes.documentation: Value associated with this label.

elements.name: entities::constant_relation
elements.documentation: Represents a relation between archetypes, fixed to a logical model element.

attributes.name: logical_model_element_id
attributes.documentation:
ID of the logical model element that the relation is fixed against.

Element must exist in the current loaded models.

attributes.name: type
attributes.documentation: How these archetypes are related.

attributes.name: original_urn
attributes.documentation:
URN which may or may not be an archetype URN.

 It must have the form "archetype:" if pointing to an archetype, or  "label:" if 
pointing to a label, and then is followed by "KEY:VALUE". The label must resolve
to a unique archetype.

attributes.name: resolved_urn
attributes.documentation:
URN pointing to the archetype.

 It must have the form "archetype:".

elements.name: entities::variable_relation_type
elements.documentation: Lists all of the valid variable relation types.

attributes.name: self
attributes.documentation: Logical element is related to itself across different projections.

attributes.name: parent
attributes.documentation: Parent of logical element.

attributes.name: child
attributes.documentation: Child of logical element.

attributes.name: transparent
attributes.documentation: The relation with another logical element requires the element's full definition.

attributes.name: opaque
attributes.documentation: The relation with another logical element does not requires its full definition.

attributes.name: associative_key
attributes.documentation: The associated element is used as an associative key.

attributes.name: visitation
attributes.documentation: The associated element visits or is visited by the current element.

elements.name: entities::relations
elements.documentation: Models relationships between archetypes.

attributes.name: status
attributes.documentation: Status of this archetype with regards to being related to archetypes.

attributes.name: constant
attributes.documentation:
All archetypes this archetype is related to,  over a fixed logical meta-model
element.

attributes.name: variable
attributes.documentation:
All archetypes this archetype is related to,  over a variable logical meta-model
element.

elements.name: entities::hard_coded_relation
elements.documentation: Relations against hard-coded values.

elements.name: entities::artefact_set
elements.documentation: Represents a slice of logical-physical space fixed at one logical point.

attributes.name: logical_meta_element_id
attributes.documentation: Identifier of the meta-element in the logical dimension.

attributes.name: logical_element_id
attributes.documentation: Identifier of the element in the logical dimension.

attributes.name: artefacts_by_archetype
attributes.documentation: All artefacts that are contained within this set, organised by archetype.

attributes.name: archetype_for_role
attributes.documentation: Resolves a role into a concrete archetype, in the context of this logical element.
